sentences.english: Her first husband died from a brain tumor and she was left with three small children.
sentences.chinese: 她第一任丈夫死於腦瘤，給她留下了三個年幼的孩子。

sentences.english: Cell Phone Use Endangers Boneheads The jury is still out on the relationship between cell phone use and brain tumors.
sentences.chinese: 使用手機和罹患腦瘤之間的關係目前還沒有定論。

sentences.english: Objective:To discuss the reason of brain tumor apoplexy after Gamma Knife treatment.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討腦瘤患者伽瑪刀治療後腫瘤卒中的原因。

sentences.english: Brain tumors have been knowen to cause auditory and visual hallucinations.
sentences.chinese: 腦瘤會引起聽覺和視覺上的幻覺。

sentences.english: More than forty percent of growths in the brain are gliomas .
sentences.chinese: 超過百分之四十的腦瘤是由於神經膠質瘤。

sentences.english: He had a tumour. When it had been removed, his paedophilic tendencies went away.
sentences.chinese: 當他的腦瘤被割除的時候，他那些怪癖消失了。

sentences.english: The jury is still out on the relationship between cell phone use and brain tumors.
sentences.chinese: 使用手機和罹患腦瘤之間的關係目前還沒有定論。

definition: biopsy/abbr. for 活體組織檢查|活体组织检查[huo2 ti3 zu3 zhi1 jian3 cha2]
medical doctor/physician who works primarily by administering drugs, as opposed to surgeon 外科醫生|外科医生[wai4 ke1 yi1 sheng1]
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
